text: guys let me ask you a question what is
better than a Chocolate Chunk cookie
pretty much nothing right today's recipe
it's a variation in a Chocolate Chunk
cookie that uses farro flour instead of
regular flour so it's better for you but
just as delicious in this bowl I have
three cups of farro flour and to that
I'm adding one and a quarter teaspoons
of baking powder and 1/4 teaspoon of
baking soda a teaspoon of coarse salt if
you're using fine salt please make sure
you use a half a teaspoon whisk that
together so farro flour you could also
use spelt flour I mean if you wanted to
you could also use regular flour but I
love the nuttiness that you get from a
flower like a farro over here I have two
sticks of unsalted butter cream it with
2 cups of dark brown sugar cream that
while you're waiting for that to cream
you can cut up your nuts one cup of
walnuts I like to use this serrated
knife that has a little offset in the
handle it's really great your knuckles
don't hit the board and the serrations
in the knife cut straight through the
nuts really well also fantastic for
chocolate okay
when your butter and sugar have creamed
you can add your egg two large eggs one
at a time
one more
caribou track scrape down the bowl to
make sure your ingredients are well
mixed this is very nice and light and
fluffy and then just add all my dry
ingredients cookies unlike cakes you can
just add all your dry ingredients at
once Cakes not so much
beat to combine starting off slow and
then getting a little faster and then
you can add your chocolate this is one
and a half cups of coarsely chopped
bittersweet chocolate or semi-sweet
actually I like a semi-sweet but you can
use bittersweet one cup of chopped dates
you can also use raisins golden raisins
pieces of apricot cranberries cherries
whatever you want
I love the dates cuz they give like a
caramel a note and I'm already getting
those caramel e notes from the brown
sugar but not everybody likes dates
right and then the nuts those can go in
as well
beat two combined
and this is chock-full of delicious
goodies whatsit caps and baking sheets
lined with parchment and the oven
preheated to 350 degrees and then you
can scoop and bake as always you can
also scoop your cookies and freeze them
and bake them off whenever you want some
cookies I want some cookies right now so
this is probably about a two tablespoon
scoop whose are a pretty decent sized
cookie if you want minis you can do one
tablespoon but these are two and they'll
take about 15 minutes to bake at 350
degrees so then they come out of the
oven and you have to let them cool this
is my favorite one because I can see
that it has the most chocolate chunks in
it so that's the one that I'm gonna eat
it's so hot in here guys that these are
completely cool but the chocolate is
still melted so remember when I was
talking about how nutty the Farrow flour
makes this and how caramely it becomes
from the dates and the brown sugar I
wasn't kidding it really is it's a
caramel e nutty chocolaty heavenly
cookie
you
